intro: Fibraurea chloroleuca, commonly known as the white-leaf fibraurea, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive white or pale green leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal regions. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
